thread.title: Pope Francis's Address to Congress: Will John Boehner and Joe Biden Both Cry?
thread.title_full: Pope Francis's Address to Congress: Will John Boehner and Joe Biden Both Cry? - The Atlantic

author: Emma Green
title: Pope Francis's Address to Congress: Will John Boehner and Joe Biden Both Cry?
text:
Never before has a pope taken on the United States Congress. On Thursday morning, Francis will change that: He’ll give a short speech, in English, to a joint session in the House chamber.
Related Story Pope Francis's Visit to the U.S.
The best thing to watch will be the aerobics. Congressional addresses are notorious for their thick politics of who sits and who stands and who claps when, and this speech should be no different. Francis will be flanked on either side by two Catholics, John Boehner and Joe Biden, who hold very different views on issues the pope may talk about, including climate change, abortion, and poverty.
In an interview with America magazine in September , Biden said he hadn’t spoken with Boehner about the speech. “We’ve now done seven State of the Union addresses, and we joke with one another, and John will say, ‘Don’t stand on everything, would you please?’” Biden said. “John’s a good guy. We’ll both be sitting there with a great deal of pride.”
